trans-unit.source: Wraps an XSD <xref uid="langword_csharp_gYearMonth" name="gYearMonth" href=""></xref> type.
For more information about XSD data types, see "XML Data Types Reference" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth"></xref> class with a specified <xref:System.DateTime> object.
A <xref:System.DateTime> object to initialize the current instance.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth"></xref> class with a specified <xref:System.DateTime> object and an integer that indicates whether <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth.Value*> is a positive or negative value.
An integer of less than 0 indicates a negative `sign`.
A <xref:System.DateTime> object to initialize the current instance.
An integer that indicates whether `value` is positive.
Returns the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the current SOAP type.
A <xref:System.String> that indicates the XSD of the current SOAP type.
Converts the specified <xref:System.String> into a <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth"></xref> object.
The Parse method is capable of parsing strings in various formats.
The recognizable string formats are composed out of the following format patterns.
|Format Pattern|Description|Examples| |--------------------|-----------------|--------------| |yyyy|The year in 4-digit format.|1999, 1812| |MM|The numeric month.
Single-digit months have a leading zero.|11, 05| |zzz|The full time zone offset (hour and minutes) from the Universal Time Coordinate (Greenwich Mean Time).
Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|-07:00, 08:00|
The <xref:System.String> to convert
A object that is obtained from value.
value does not contain a date and time that corresponds to any of the recognized format patterns.
Gets or sets whether the date and time of the current instance is positive or negative.
An integer of less than 0 indicates a negative Sign.
An integer that indicates whether <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth.Value*> is positive or negative.
Returns a <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth.Value*> as a <xref:System.String>.

A <xref:System.String> that is obtained from <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth.Value*> in the format "yyyy-MM" or "'-'yyyy-MM" if <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth.Sign*> is negative.
Gets or sets the date and time of the current instance.
The <xref:System.DateTime> object that contains the date and time of the current instance.
Gets the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the current SOAP type.
A <xref:System.String> that indicates the XSD of the current SOAP type.
